oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Hannah Morey to James M. Morey
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Dear Son... Wish you could hear Dora and Charly sing. There's a light in the window for thee, brother. It would make you cry, at least it does me. You ask me not to grieve myself sick for you. I must weep for all the mental and physical sufferings"

Corporal James Marsh Morey served in the 32nd Tennessee Infantry Regiment, which was organized at Camp Trousdale, Sumner County, in 1861. Morey was born in Jonesboro, Washington County, Tennessee, in 1844, but the family moved to Franklin in 1858.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Letters; American Civil War, letters and diaries; Civil war; Sherman, William T. (William Tecumseh), 1820-1891;
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hannah M. Morey
